enhanced_information: Chlorpropamide is a sulfonylurea that stimulates insulin release and is used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus. Importantly, it also has an antidiuretic effect, which allows it to be used in the treatment of diabetes insipidus. In contrast, Glibenclamide, Glicazide, and Glipizide are also sulfonylureas that primarily treat type 2 diabetes mellitus but do not have any known effects on diabetes insipidus. Therefore, the only drug among the options that treats both conditions is Chlorpropamide.
analysis: Chlorpropamide is a sulfonylurea that not only stimulates insulin release to manage type 2 diabetes mellitus but also possesses an antidiuretic effect, making it effective in treating diabetes insipidus. Therefore, based on the consensus in pharmacology, Chlorpropamide is the only drug listed that treats both conditions.
